question_title: How many runs will be scored in the knockout stage of the 2026 World Baseball Classic?
summary: The 2026 WBC knockout stage has 7 games (same format as 2023). Historical data shows enormous variance: runs per game ranged from 4.0 (2013) to 11.0 (2009/2023). The 2023 tournament (only 7-game precedent) totaled 76 runs. Monte Carlo simulation using game-level variance and tournament effects yields a median of ~62-65 runs. My distribution centers between the 2023 result (76 runs) and historical average (~57 runs for 7 games), with wide uncertainty reflecting the high tournament-to-tournament variance. Key factors: pitcher matchups in knockout games, potential blowouts, and the unpredictable nature of single-elimination baseball.

factors.description: 2023 direct analog: 76 runs in 7 knockout games (10.86 RPG) - the only same-format precedent
Historical tournament average is 8.1 RPG, which yields 57 runs for 7 games - pulling estimate lower than 2023
Tournament-to-tournament variance is extremely high (2013 had 4 RPG vs 2009/2023 had 11 RPG) - widens uncertainty
WBC historically features higher scoring than regular MLB due to unfamiliar pitcher-batter matchups and international play atmosphere
No major rule changes for 2026 that would systematically affect scoring
